item.title: [Team_Rocket] Simple Debugging Lines [Client]
item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

Rescuing this for a couple of reasons:

  1. A lot of users seem to find this very useful.

  2. There are still people trying to develop their R.S.P.S. who type out, “::mypos”, “::coords:”, “::pos”, etc. This eliminates the need for that command to exist.

Read full topic

item.title: [Team_Rocket] Simple Debugging Lines [Client]
item.dc:creator: @relexlawl relexlawl
item.description:
@relexlawl wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:21, topic:469851”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=587165.msg4168610#msg4168610 date=1353985458]

You can simplify your commands into one command:

if (inputString.equals("::toggledebug")) { clientDebugging = !clientDebugging; }

Anywho, interesting, may be handy to me in the future. Thanks.

if (inputString.equals("::toggledebug")) clientDebugging = !clientDebugging;
That’s what randqm would say to me

That’s the same thing…

I know, I’m talking about the brackets. RandQm would tell me, “Terrible.” Then remove the brackets. Ever since them I started doing so.

I know what you’re talking about, but do you?

Neither way is wrong, nor ‘better’ than the other…

It’s a matter of personal choice

Whatever you prefer, not RandQm.
[/quote]

What I prefer is should be done by everyone.
lul no I just always tell that it isn’t actually necessary, I like to keep thinks as small as possible; looks better to me than a bunch of brackets[/quote]

…Righhht…Brackets are sooooo disgustinngg ewwwww.

But it’s just a personal preference. The thing that isn’t right, though, is to tell others to do it one way or the other, when as a matter of fact it should be based on their own preference.

Read full topic

Anywho, interesting, may be handy to me in the future. Thanks.[/quote]

[11/24/2012 9:12:23 PM] .Jack: and it switches on/off with that, which is easier and more simplified.

item.title: [Team_Rocket] Simple Debugging Lines [Client]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:13, topic:469851”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=587165.msg4167294#msg4167294 date=1353854725]
You can simplify your commands into one command:

if (inputString.equals("::toggledebug")) { clientDebugging = !clientDebugging; }

Anywho, interesting, may be handy to me in the future. Thanks.
[/quote]

if (inputString.equals("::toggledebug")) clientDebugging = !clientDebugging;
That’s what randqm would say to me ;)[/quote]
You don’t have to do that… that’s not convention its just personal preference. Most people just use brackets. why? Because its cleaner and if you ever need to add more than one line you don’t need to re-add the brackets

Read full topic
